interface.name: SupportedValuesAttribute
interface.javadoc:
Interface SupportedValuesAttribute is a tagging interface which a printing attribute class implements to indicate the attribute describes the supported values for another attribute. For example, if a Print Service instance supports the {@link javax.print.attribute.standard.Copies Copies}attribute, the Print Service instance will have a {@link javax.print.attribute.standard.CopiesSupported CopiesSupported} attribute, which is a SupportedValuesAttribute giving the legal values a client may specify for the {@link javax.print.attribute.standard.Copies Copies}attribute.

Alan Kaminsky
